text:
Many Jews came to comfort Martha and Mary about their brother.

When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went to meet Him, but Mary stayed at home. 

Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died. But I know that even now, whatever You ask God, He will give it to You."

She stopped, feeling embarrassed that her voice might shake again.

Jesus told her, "Your brother will rise again."

Martha replied, "I know he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day."

Jesus said, "I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in Me, even if they die, will live. And everyone who lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?"

She answered, "Yes, Lord. I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God who is coming into the world."

She paused and looked up at Him, but then controlled herself and continued reading. Raskolnikov sat still, with his elbows on the table and his eyes turned away. She read up to the thirty-second verse.

When Mary came to where Jesus was and saw Him, she fell at His feet and said, "Lord, if..."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia reads a passage from the Bible about faith and resurrection, expressing her belief in Jesus as the Christ.
